Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 1-3 Low temperature 20-21C low pressure 1 bar zero vibration zero material flow tool position 0 low energy 0.4-0.5 kWh This appears to be an idle or standby state

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Events 4-6 Temperature rising 50-55-58 pressure increases slightly 1-1.5 bar vibration rising 30-35-38 material flow steady at 5 tool position increasing 5-7-10 energy rising 2-2.5-3 This seems like an active process with increasing activity

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 7-8 Temperature drops to 40C pressure 2 bar vibration drops to 10 Hz material flow drops to 2 tool position at 15 mm energy 2 kWh This is a different phase moderate temperature higher pressure than before lower vibration lower flow tool position steady

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Event 9 Temperature spikes to 80C vibration jumps to 50 Hz material flow 0 tool position still 15 energy jumps to 5 kWh This is a high-energy high-temperature high-vibration event with no material flow Possibly a welding or heating operation without material feeding

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the whole sequence it seems like a cycle idle some process another process a high-energy process cooling light activity idle

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Cutting Metal Often involves high vibration maybe temperature increase material flow tool movement Could correspond to events 4-6 Assembling Parts Typically lower energy maybe some pressure tool movement not high temperature or vibration Could be events 7-8 Welding High temperature possibly high energy might have no material flow tool position steady Event 9 looks like welding Quality Inspection Might involve sensors low energy little movement Events 11-12

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The process flow The machine starts idle then begins cutting machining events 4-6 then transitions to a pressure-based operation events 7-8 then welding event 9 then cools down event 10 then does some light operation events 11-12 then returns to idle Typical manufacturing cutting then assembling which might involve pressing or fastening then welding then inspection then back to idle

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Tool position starts at 0 moves during cutting 5 7 10 then jumps to 15 and stays there during assembling and welding then moves to 20 during inspection then back to 0 Material flow during cutting high 5 during assembling lower 2 during welding 0 during inspection 1 Energy cutting medium 2-3 kWh assembling medium 2 kWh welding high 5 kWh inspection low 1.5 kWh

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Alternatively we could group events 10-12 as a single phase Cooling and Finishing Alternatively merge events 9-10 as Welding and Cooling but they are quite different Event 10 is very short and might be grouped with event 9 or 11 However sensor readings change significantly so separate
